> > What if hive with kerberos? Most companies will enable kerberos in the production environment.
> 
> @zhuxt2015 Good question. AFAIK, currently DS task plugins do not support `kerberos` except `SQL tasks with datasource`. I've added instructions in docs about how to choose between `hive datasource` and `hive cli task plugin` for different scenarios. If they enable `kerberos`, they could use `SQL tasks with hive datasource` to connect to `hiveserver2` with `jdbc` at this moment.
> 
> However, it will be great if other task plugins like `spark task plugin`, `hive cli task plugin`, etc. could support `kerberos` in the future. May I ask whether you have any suggestions or ideas on how to do it? Thanks.

1. hive command bypasses permission management,  In most cases it will be disabled in a production environment。
2. If you have to use hive command with kerberos be enabled. execute `kinit -kt <keytab path> <principal> ` before execute hive command ,

> > > What if hive with kerberos? Most companies will enable kerberos in the production environment.
> > 
> > 
> > @zhuxt2015 Good question. AFAIK, currently DS task plugins do not support `kerberos` except `SQL tasks with datasource`. I've added instructions in docs about how to choose between `hive datasource` and `hive cli task plugin` for different scenarios. If they enable `kerberos`, they could use `SQL tasks with hive datasource` to connect to `hiveserver2` with `jdbc` at this moment.
> > However, it will be great if other task plugins like `spark task plugin`, `hive cli task plugin`, etc. could support `kerberos` in the future. May I ask whether you have any suggestions or ideas on how to do it? Thanks.
> 
> 1. hive command bypasses permission management,  In most cases it will be disabled in a production environment。
> 2. If you have to use hive command with kerberos be enabled. execute `kinit -kt <keytab path> <principal> ` before execute hive command ,

@zhuxt2015 Thanks for the information.

1. For the first point, we have the same situation with `spark-submit`, `spark-sql`, `flink run`, etc. besides `hive` considering permissions. We could abstract this and make it apply to all those task plugins. Would you like to submit an issue and give a shot? @zhuxt2015 
2. `HiveServer2` is mainly used for `ad-hoc` query. In production, `HiveServer2` is not a good practice for scheduled big data tasks. We have seen several cases of production failures.

@rickchengx @ruanwenjun I also submitted a PR # 9680, which needs to be the premise to fix this bug, because the application ID of yarn needs to be parsed in the program execution log and get appids,Please see the impact method in the following figure. I will send the detailed operation process here, but it will take some time. Give me one day.

because kill command will failed, such as Operation not permitted. If u install ds as root user, then u run this shelltask as foo user, such as 'sudo -u foo sh xxx', the user of this process still is root, not foo. So cannot use 'sudo -u foo kill xxx'. Because foo cannot kill root process. I think this is root cause.

@cadl 

The reason for the exception:

The shell process execution timed out,

```
boolean status = process.waitFor(remainTime, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
```

Variable `status=false`, execute process.exitValue(), because the process does not end, this method will throw IllegalThreadStateException,

```
            logger.error("process has failure , exitStatusCode:{}, processExitValue:{}, ready to kill ...",
                    result.getExitStatusCode(), process.exitValue());
```

This issue has been fixed in this PR #11099, currently in the dev branch, not released to the 3.0.0 branch.

After repair:
Variable `status=false`, execute ProcessUtils.kill(taskRequest); use `kill -9 xxx` to kill the shell process directly without executing soft kill

All works as before, when users want to change the configuration, just create a patch config like this, and it's all done.

```shell
cat <<EOF | kubectl apply -f -
apiVersion: v1
data:
  application.yml: |-
    worker:
      exec-threads: 30
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: standalone-server
  namespace: default
EOF
```
